DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-COMPLETO: Paulo Henrique Pereira de Meneses Vaz
DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: VAZ, P. H. P. M.;Vaz, Paulo Henrique;Vaz, Paulo

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Professor Adjunto do Departamento de Economia da UFPE, onde atua na graduação e na pós-graduação, lecionando cursos na área de Desenvolvimento Econômico, Macroeconomia e Micro-econometria Aplicada. Atualmente é vice-coordenador do Programa de Pós-graduação em Economia (PIMES), coordenador do Grupo de Avaliação de Políticas Públicas e Econômicas (GAPPE) e membro do Programa de Pós-Graduação Profissional em Gestão e Economia da Saúde (PPGGES). Tem experiência na área de Avaliação de Políticas Públicas, Produtividade de Firmas, Desenvolvimento e Crescimento Econômico de Longo Prazo.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Adjunct Professor at the Department of Economics at UFPE, teaching courses in the area of Economic Development, Macroeconomics and Applied Micro-econometrics for both undergraduate and graduate levels. He is currently vice-head of the Graduate Program in Economics (PIMES) at UFPE, coordinator of the Public and Economic Policy Evaluation Group (GAPPE) and member of the Professional Graduate Program in Health Management and Economics (PPGGES). He has experience in the area of Public Policy Evaluation, Firm Productivity, Long-Term Development.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: On the Combination of Well-Intended Policies: Subsidized Credit and Local Content Requirements
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: After the 2009 financial crisis, expansionary policies embedded with local content requirement were widely used in both developed and underdeveloped economies. The final effects of such policies are unclear. In the short term it may generate employment, though in the long term misallocation of resources might yield aggregate productivity stagnation and/or instability, which plagues economic growth. We propose a formal examination of short and long-term effects on aggregate productivity of firms having access to subsidized credit, conditional on local content requirement. To this end, we build a model economy with government, development bank and international trade. The development bank subsidizes resources for domestic heterogeneous firms, specially small ones, whereas they require a minimum demand of domestic intermediate goods. More specifically, this bank may contribute to the reduction of financial frictions and to the improvement of network connections domestically (in case there is room for learning-by-doing sort of argument, regarding infant industry). At the same time, this bank policy may produce resource misallocation, reducing aggregate productivity and/or its growth, and political instability due to uncertainty about the future of fiscal and regulatory regimes.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Paulo Henrique Pereira de Meneses Vaz
INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VAZ, P. H. P. M.;Vaz, Paulo Henrique;Vaz, Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Produtividade Total dos Fatores e Macrodesenvolvimento
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: De forma abrangente o projeto inclui pesquisas relacionadas ao tema da produtividade total dos fatores e crescimento econômico. O enfoque teórico se concentra nos modelos de firmas heterogeneas, estudando o papel das falhas de mercado e/ou distorções sobre a produtividade das firmas e alocação de recursos entre elas. Empiricamente, o foco é na conexão micro-macro, fazendo uso de microdados, mas conectando-os com informações agregadas de interesse da macroeconomia.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Paulo Henrique Pereira de Meneses Vaz
INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VAZ, P. H. P. M.;Vaz, Paulo Henrique;Vaz, Paulo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Safe Drinking Water and Child Mortality: Evidence from a large scale program in the Brazilian semiarid
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: A considerable part of the rural population in developing countries lives in a water-scarce environment with high rates of child mortality due to water-related diseases. This project studies the effect of providing safe drinking water on child mortality from diarrhoeal diseases, the third leading cause of death in children under five years old and the first among water-related ones. Our identification strategy exploits a program which distributes rainwater harvesting systems to families located on the most densely populated semiarid zone in the world.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Economia da Saúde: Eficiência e Políticas Públicas
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Tendo em vista a necessidade de se avaliar a eficiência do serviço prestado na saúde pública, esse projeto pretende unir métodos quantitativos disponíveis para mensuração de eficiência e avaliação de políticas públicas com o conhecimento prático dos alunos do Programa de Pós-Graduação em Gestão e Economia da Saúde (PPGGES).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Reduction and Simplification of Taxes on Small Manufacturing Firms: An Application of Regression Discontinuity
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Small businesses are important to the economic growth of developing countries. The project evaluates the causal effect of reducing bureaucracy and the tax burden on small manufacturing firms in Brazil. The identification explored the eligibility threshold associated to the Simples Nacional program. Microdata from the Annual Industrial Survey (PIA) were used for the period 2000 to 2012. Results suggest that companies participating in the program have reduced the industrial operational cost by 23%, increased job creation in 21.5% and payroll in 25.18%

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Innovation Coordination Failures and Endogenous Productivity: On the dynamic effect of misallocation
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Innovation Coordination Failures and Endogenous Productivity: On the dynamic effect of misallocation

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Paulo Henrique Pereira de Meneses Vaz

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT. Several papers have shown that misallocation of resources among heterogeneous firms can have damaging consequences for countries? total factor productivity. The present work studies the impact of these distortions when they affect not only the present productivity, but also the dynamics of future productivity, in an environment where agent decisions can generate coordination failures. This analysis will be carried out from a general equilibrium model of heterogeneous firms with partially endogenous productivity, in which firms have the ability to affect their future productivity by means of risky experiments, which take the form of productivity shocks, and coordination failures are generated from a complementarity of demand. Equilibrium analyses state the boundary conditions for extreme scenarios, with pure strategy, in which none or all firms invest in innovation, or for an intermediary scenario, with mixed strategies. Those conditions, however, are sensitive to aggregate and productivity-dependent distortions, suggesting that the current causes of misallocation of resources may carry long-lasting consequences to the growth path of TFP as well.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Producers? expectation shocks and Business cycles
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: Producers? expectation shocks and Business cycles

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Paulo Henrique Pereira de Meneses Vaz

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: ABSTRACT. This paper assesses producer-expectation-driven business cycle fluctuations. Based on theoretical predictions of a multi-sector model with market frictions and adjustment cost, and using a unique panel of producer-level data, it seeks to unravel the patterns of dynamic responses to producers? expectation shocks. Overall, there is microevidence of co-movements among firm?s production, employment, investment intention and capacity utilization due to positive expectation shocks. Moreover, the effect seems permanent on firm?s outcomes and highly persistent on investment intentions fluctuations. Findings suggest that producers? expectation shocks explain between 6 and 10% of output fluctuations, which is a non-negligible explanation power and may offer support to the news-driven business cycle literature. Still, the theoretical model developed illustrates how adjustment costs and labor market frictions could be dragging down the measured impact.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: Coordination Failures and Endogenous Productivity: A General Equilibrium Approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: Coordination Failures and Endogenous Productivity: A General Equilibrium Approach

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Numerous empirical research has shown that the misallocation of resources among heterogeneous firms can have highly damaging consequences for countries? productivity. The present work studies the impact of these distortions when they affect not only the present productivity, but also the dynamics of future productivity, in an environment where the decisions of the agents can generate coordination failures. This analysis will be carried out from a standard model of heterogeneous firms, with evolution of partially endogenous productivity. In this model, firms have the ability to affect their future productivity by means of risky experiments, which take the form of productivity shocks, and coordination failures are generated from a complementarity of demand.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: TAX COMPLIANCE COSTS AND FIRM GROWTH: EVIDENCE FROM BRAZIL
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: TAX COMPLIANCE COSTS AND FIRM GROWTH: EVIDENCE FROM BRAZIL

DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Small and Micro sized enterprises (SMEs) are particularly important in the developing countries as they play a key contribution to employment, innovation and economic growth. The majority of the countries in the Western world have some differentiated tax treatment for those types of enterprises as they might be a great moving force on job generation and a potentially fount of productivity growth. The differentiated tax treatment also aims to affect firms? life-cycle and longevity, especially for young enterprises (OECD, 2015). In this work, we wish to estimate the causal impact over firms? growth, of a major reduction of tax compliance costs for small manufacturing firms in Brazil, one of the worst countries regarding the payment of business taxes. In order to do so, we will exploit a difference-in-difference framework, in order to estimate the effect of a tax compliance cost reduction and bureaucracy reductions over firm growth, as a result of the implementation of the Simples Nacional program.
